title: ICE when combine some macro and trait

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

body:
This crash occurred when I compile some code that simulate C# linq.

I use Windows 8.1 64-bit but I tried to compile this code with playpen and it also crashed so I think the bug is not related to platform.

> rustc 1.0.0-nightly (44a287e6e 2015-01-08 17:03:40 -0800)
> binary: rustc
> commit-hash: 44a287e6eb22ec3c2a687fc156813577464017f7
> commit-date: 2015-01-08 17:03:40 -0800
> host: i686-pc-windows-gnu
> release: 1.0.0-nightly

``` Rust
trait A<T> { fn b(self, T); }
impl<T> A<T> for (){ fn b(self, _: T) {} }
macro_rules! c {
    { $d:expr, $e:expr } => ( $d.b(|&:| $e.b(|&:| ())) )
}
fn main(){ c! { (), () } }
```

